website_summaries.verdict: High-quality speakers that deliver powerful, room-filling sound and plug-and-play connection to multiple devices.
pros: Simple to use with any computer, TV, tablet, smartphone, or game console
Boast deep bass response that adds intensity to music, movies and games
Sleek design makes the speakers outstanding additions in any living room
cons: Cords to the speakers along with the auxiliary cable are short
Bluetooth connection leaves much to be desired

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: People should be aware that the top speaker (the tweeter) is fake
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Chelsom

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed these speakers, decent sound quality for the price- Unfortunately not even 10 months after purchasing they gave out. I use these for animation/editing work so safe to say I wasn't cranking these to 11 or even halfway on the controller for that matter. I tested my drivers first as well as plugging audio into different devices, no sound comes from the speakers but if headphones are plugged into the volume controller sound blares out despite whatever level the controller knob is on. Very sad to see these go, I'm hoping I can get a factory replacement on these considering they didn't even last the year.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Fake speaker
customer_reviews.text: The tweeter is fake. These are my speakers. Not reposting from another site. Never buying anything from Logitech again.
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: I loved these speakers until out of the blue
customer_reviews.text: I loved these speakers until out of the blue, not even a year after purchasing... they just stopped. The light is still on, everything else looks normal except now there's no sound.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I have been looking for. If your looking for a mello bass and something that doesn't shake and rattle your walls and windows but a very nice bass and decent highs then this is for you. This suits my purposes very well. Doesn't distort at higher volumes and sounds good at lower volumes. Works well with gaming, watching streaming movies, and music. If your looking for ground shaking, walls cracking and windows rattling bass then your going to have to pay much more $$, and for me I live in a quiet neighborhood and respect my neighbors. If I need to hear that kind of sound I would by some very nice headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers, with one serious flaw
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality isn't bad for a $50 multimedia speaker system. I find the bass level is adequate for most of what I listen to, but if you're looking for speakers that will rattle the furniture, these aren't them. However, the trade-off for that is a cleaner sound overall, compared to most of the computer speakers I've heard. However, there is one design failure with this system that I cannot overlook: The control knob cannot be disconnected from the subwoofer/amp module, and because of that, you may find it impossible (as I have) to route the control knob through the cord pass-through at the back of my desk. Seriously, what were Logitech thinking of?
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Actually Impressive
customer_reviews.text: When i purchased this set of speakers, I honestly wasn't expecting too much in the quality department, but they actually perform quite well. My setup consists of an Echo Dot outside in my garage linked with only the 3.5mm audio jack. The subwoofer and speakers actually put out a decent sound and the bass is actually pretty decent as well. I thought these would be some light weight plastic speakers, but they were actually fairly heavy and seem to be above average quality. I would recommend them to anyone looking to simply boost the sound of a medium sized room.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: reasonable sound for the price point
customer_reviews.text: This isn't going to rattle windows, knock pictures off the wall nor will it break your budget. I'll put on my old curmudgeon hat and say ''you kids don't know how good you have it''. Aside from the fake tweeters that others have pointed out this thing puts out better sound than any stereo I had growing up in the 80's. ''Leans on cane'' Good for casual gaming, music, movies, documentaries, spoken word podcasts....etc. No complaints other than the 3.5mm cord is a bit short for my taste but easily resolved with a cheap female/male extension.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain with good sound!
customer_reviews.text: Ok for poor mans computer speakers. Just ok but not what you used to get. Will suffice, but look into edifier for better sound in all in one solution. What happened to Logitech and insignia for cheap good sound. This is probably best at price point. Save a little and buy DAC AMP like topping mx3 and speakers like NHT super zero's and sub like Elac sub1010. Or edifier complete 2.1. To get quality of 5yrs ago, spend a little more, will last longer and better sound. A good entry system at a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Piech

customer_reviews.title: Z333 Nice entry level set-up
customer_reviews.text: Buy them for $59.99, be satisfied. Good entry level speakers for the price, tweeters are fake but look cool. The satellites sound good at low and mid volumes, while the bass is fine through low-high. I set the knob halfway and it's plenty of bass for daily use, Sub-woofer box is decent size and kicks pretty well. Would recommend for a small/med space, perfect for movies/gaming. Lots of cable real estate to play with, everything plugs neatly into the woofer box and from there to your device. Definitely would recommend if you're looking to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: F.J.X.

customer_reviews.title: Right speaker cuts out and bass never worked right
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift to myself 9 months ago to upgrade from my old cheap Logitech speakers from 2010. Bass never worked. With bass turned to max and volume up high I had to put my ear to the subwoofer to see if it was working. It was, just very quiet. Whatever, I didn't need a lot of bass anyway. Cut to 9 months later and I'm having daily trouble getting my right speaker to make noise. Should've returned it when I could've. They sound fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Scrowe

customer_reviews.title: Superb with no tweeter.  Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Sure the tweeter might be cosmetic (haven’t opened mine), but the residual treble from the mids is plenty. Acoustic science and economics at their best. They sound great. Been running an old set overhead in our kitchen on a Google AudioCast for two years, and just bought these for my office after my 25 year old JT160’s bit the dust. Super bargain (if these new ones last at least a few years). They wouldn’t have to “fake” a tweeter if people understood anything about the frequency coverage of the 3” diaphragms. The highs ring of the the paper just fine. Huge bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: THUMPS!
customer_reviews.text: I PAYED $64 DOLLARS AND HAD IT IN MY HANDS IN 3 DAYS! THIS THUMPS PRETTY GOOD! IF YOU WANT SWEET HIGHS AND MID-RANGE LOOK AND SPEND MORE MONEY ELSEWHERE! I'M MORE THAN HAPPY WITH THIS! I HAD A POLK AUDIO 5 SPEAKER SURROUND SYSTEM FOR ALMOST 18 YEARS AND I MISS IT DEARLY BUT THIS FILLS IN NICELY! GREAT PACKAGING AND EASY SET UP! I HAVE IT UNDER MY PC TABLE ON THE FLOOR IN THE CORNER OF MY FAMILY ROOM! ...I LIKE IT!
customer_reviews.author: HACK454265

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, exactly what I wanted as an upgrade to computer speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for two days but so far so good. Nice sound, nice bass. Wasn't expecting much for $64.99 delivered, so pleasantly surprised. I have the computer volume at 100% and the Logitech button is plenty loud at 1/2, keep it at 1/4 typically. If you want to move the speakers far apart, definitely will need extender cables as the ones that come with are basically for a desk where you would put one on each corner. I need to order the extender cables in order to get a nicer surround sound. Love the speaker volume knob. Keep it right next to mouse and when phone rings, I either shut it off or just turn it down.
customer_reviews.author: 993TT

customer_reviews.title: The high end range is a bit light with no tweeter,But at half the price I am happy
customer_reviews.text: Some criticized the lack of a tweeter, and highs tend to be a little light. But after using the graphic equalizer I am satisfied. It's higher power than most helps a lot. Why I chose it. Plus it's half the cost of the new model. I liked the fact that the 3.5 input cord was built in. For it's price I am very happy. In the past I have had better sound quality but at a far greater cost. It fits my computer desk well. And it's sub woofer is not over whelming it with rattles. I would recommend it to anyone needing a lower cost unit but which still has some punch.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Graefen

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm... love the remote volume control.... no drivers to install, plug and play.... I hooked them up with another set that was similar and now I have awesome sound ! The reason is that I like the surround sound features of my sound card... These are pretty loud as they are with the sub woofer shoving out bass and the satellites handling all the other wavelengths of sound..... And for the price.., you can't beat it... if you need some low cost speakers and wants lots of sound.., get these....you'll appreciate it !!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Love the volume control settup
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with this speaker set. While the sound did not quite match the fullness of my previous one, (which after 15+ years gave up the ghost) it is close. Setup was easy - pretty much plug and play, which works for me as one who tries to do it before going to the instructions! The large separated volume control knob on a cord is a nice innovation. I love that I don't have to reach around the monitor to adjust the volume. (You do for the separate bass control - but for me it was just a case of set that once and forget it.)
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Small Budget Speakers - Big sound!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy! Really surprised how great these sounded for the price! I am not an audiophile but the sound is very rich and very clear. The control knob looks and works great. The speakers and even bass themselves are actually quite small and easy to move around. I have a 55" desk with a 27" monitor and these all fit on my desk with room to spare. It does hook up via a standard headphone jack and has back RCA input available in stereo. Pair this with the logitech bluetooth adapter and you have wireless speakers. Great buy! Always pleased by Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop speakers
customer_reviews.text: These Logitech speakers were perfect for what I needed. They won't blow your mind or anything, but you won't find anything better at this price point. Also the quality is better than other brands. The packaging was great and was a pleasure to unpack them. I have an MSI motherboard and used the Realtek HD Audio Manager to tweak the sound, which came out pretty good. Here are the settings I used: Speaker Configuration: - Stereo - Checked Virtual Surround option Sound Effects: - Environment (none) - Equalizer (Club) Format: - 24Bits, 192000 Hz
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for a 2:1 Set
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as replacement speakers for our new computer. I bought the computer as a tower only replacement for our 14yr. old desktop because we already had newer peripherals. The sound quality is great. My husband has a cover band and does all the music arragements. He says he can hear tones and notes again in the songs that were fading on the old speakers. He's a happy camper. I may even start listening to music on the computer again.
customer_reviews.author: NiteCat

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these speakers for my dorm room. Despite other reviews, I would say it definitely can fill up and room and down the hall. Great sound and good bass. I use it for movies and music and am really happy with the sound. Also the volume control is great - nice to be able to slide up and down and its very smooth and easy
customer_reviews.author: Erik T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!  (For the price, obviously.)
customer_reviews.text: These speakers aren't going to impress an audiophile, but I can always put on my headphones if that's what I'm looking for. A lot of the time, I just want to listen passively to music at low volume... and these speakers are perfect for that. The volume control was the critical selling point for me. I hate it when I get a phone call and can't figure out how to turn off the sound on my computer. With this volume control, it's right there where I can put my hand on it... and I can fiddle with it spontaneously without interrupting what I'm working on. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to give my fancy new TV some oomph given that it's got the standard lifeless built-in speakers. I got more than I expected, these things really pack a bunch, especially for the price. They're very nice, big enough to give you some bass, nice treble and a bit of surround while still being small enough to fit on a small-ish set up. Easy to set up and it has some great controls, really like the bass level on the sub and the cord for the volume control is really long, which is always nice for the immense laziness. Which I always have.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SPEAKERS but I really believe my came with manufacture ...
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME SPEAKERS but I really believe my came with manufacture defect since it has more volume power on one side than the other (it also can be a cable problem, I am not technician but the problem its really noticeable). I kinda have corrected this problem using my computer equalizer, giving more power to defected speaker so I was able to balanced the sound from both speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Kinda sad that the volume dial can't be unplugged
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is unbeatable. Looks nice and clean and works as well as I could hope, especially since I don't need to play loud music. Keeping all the volume settings around 50% has generally given me a good clear sound. Complaints are that the volume dial can't be unplugged and because of this it can't be routed through a hole in my desk or placed very far from the subwoofer. I knew that going it but it's still a bother.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Good room filling sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for the ten year old and malfunctioning 2.1 Altec Lansing computer speakers that I used as my HDTV's primary speakers. I had immediate satisfaction with this speaker system after plugging it into the headphone jack on the HDTV, it's exactly what I wanted and I was impressed with the sound quality. These are more than enough to fill the room size with good quality sound from TV shows, movies, and PlayStation 4 games. The only thing I would have preferred would've been rigid grill covers like plastic over the speakers because the cloth they have could probably get damaged if something smacked into them.
customer_reviews.author: Claudetta

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in 2017 from Amazon, and so far they have been really great. Out of the box they sounded to flat for me, so I adjusted the equalizer on my motherboard's audio control panel software. That seemed to do the trick because they have had very rich, great sound ever since. Sound is subjective to the listener, so some may find these don't have enough of what they are looking for. The build quality it excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D. Ripplinger

customer_reviews.title: Very good Computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are good above average speakers for a desktop setup. I like the larger size speakers as they look more modern and clean on the desk as opposed the smaller ones offered by logitech. The sound quality is above average and bass very deep. I mainly bought these to complement my setup and deliver good quality when necessary. I also like having the wired controller to control both volume, power, and to plug in headphones. Overall, these are very good speakers for the design and sound they offer.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers
customer_reviews.text: I honestly would ignore all the negative reviews of these speakers. I've had them for almost 2 years now and I've been blown away with how crystal clear the sound is and how perfect the bass response is. For $60 you really can't go wrong, the bass punches and is super crisp and they're awesome. I know it's completely different and probably a poor comparsion but I have DT 990 Pro 250 ohm headphones and these blow them out of the water.. again though, comparing headphones to speakers is dumb.
customer_reviews.author: edieterich1

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected, but also not as strong as I expected / my last set of Logitech of a different model. I had bought another brand to replace my logitech I had for (brace yourselves) ~ 16 years ~ after they FINALLY died.... and the new brand died after 1 year, and were not as good as the 16 year old pair I lost. These might not be as strong but they are reasonable for the price and I expect them to last another 16 years.
customer_reviews.author: seven_deadlies

customer_reviews.title: Read the LOWER Reviews. These are not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is poor. No hi-frequency sound and they are very midrange focussed. The fake tweeter should have been my sign. I should have saw the pictures of the fake tweeter because they don't have a higher Frequency response to them at all. Sounds like your in a hallway. The power is fine for the money and the bass is OK for the money. I wished I did more research prior to picking them.
customer_reviews.author: M Pro

customer_reviews.title: I like the convenience of the volume knob
customer_reviews.text: These replaced my old 10+ year old 2.1 set of Logitech speakers (still work but wanted an upgrade, handed down to family). I like the convenience of the volume knob, the speakers a little larger than previous set but not too big. The only con I have is that the cables for the two side speakers are not the longest and I cannot stretch them to the side as far as I would of liked. For most desktop uses it is pretty adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: best pc speakers i have ever owned. coming from logitech z-10
customer_reviews.text: when I picked them up and saw the box was tiny was worried they would not sound good because when u look at the stock images on the internet they look big compared to what they actually look like in person. but to my amazement, they sound sooo good. deep bass especially in movies a games. they fill the room with good surround sound. I really love them and I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: smithpachi

customer_reviews.title: Bass is pitiful on this system
customer_reviews.text: I have an Amazon 25watts 2.1 system I gave to my kid for school which kicks butt. The bass on that little system is awesome. So when I saw this at double the wattage, I figured it would really sound good. Nope. I have the bass maxed out and it's pitiful. If you listen to music or game that uses bass? This isn't for you. Returned this and will keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: omg

customer_reviews.title: but actually pretty awesome. When watching kids shows they are solid
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my 7 years old Z323 speakers that have served me well. These speakers are slightly bigger, slightly deeper base, slightly higher quality mid & high ranges. My TV’s speakers are ridiculously awful, & these speakers make my TV not only watchable, but actually pretty awesome. When watching kids shows they are solid, but when truly cranked listening to a music video, they do not give out/distort. I’m surprised, but it’s true. - 47 yr old Dad...
customer_reviews.author: urojet12

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for my TV using RCA cables. Great upgrade! I have a set of the lesser version (Z313) set up for my wife's computer and the difference is notable. Since it's on our primary entertainment system, we wanted something with more power without distorting, and this does nicely. The variable bass is great for you to decide just how much you want things to shake. The volume control knob is bulky, so you need fairly large holes if you need to pass it through.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dean

customer_reviews.title: Weak, Muddy Bass
customer_reviews.text: The subwoofer did provide sound and thump-thumps, but the bass notes weren't clear at all. If I play a solo bass line through this system what comes out is mud. (Was it defective?...) The two stereo speakers were good, but that's not good enough. My car's basic stereo system delivers far clearer bass! Very disappointed with this product. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Humbug Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Happy then not so happy
customer_reviews.text: Had the Z333 system for my PC for over 2 years. Good sound quality. I guess the tweeter is fake? The problem: the jack connection to my laptop has gotten worse with a "humming" background noise caused by the electric charge emitted by the jack. This is quite annoying to me and causing me to consider the newer sli more expensive Z337 which has blue tooth connection. That would solve this fkd up jack problem - spend the extra if considering this model.
customer_reviews.author: S Bechard

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The fake tweeters are lame, but the sound is very good anyway, especially for the price. I'm using these with my TV so the volume know isn't really useful, but would be on a PC for sure plus the headphone jack on the module too. I can hear what people are saying in television shows much better with these than the previous speakers I had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item was well packaged and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace a 6-year-old set of speakers. Item was well packaged and easy to set up. They sound great, with a little adjustment of the equalizer settings. They are not very heavy on the bass but this is to be expected with a lower watt system. One thing, it would have been nice to be able to unplug the volume control in order to run it through my cable management system. Not a big deal, but as it is hard-wired to the subwoofer, the wire has to be run across my whole desktop.
customer_reviews.author: B. Allan

customer_reviews.title: Logitech is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buy Logitech for 20 years now, its always the first brand Ill check out and buy dealing with computer accessories, and they still have yet to disappoint. Such good, and quality products. These speakers can get pretty loud, too loud for my apartment, but I still love em. When you turn the bass up it gives such a good crisp bass sound. I suggest these.
customer_reviews.author: CoconutTiki

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: They are bigger than I expected but that's my own fault for not looking at the dimensions closely. Once I plugged them in though I had no regrets. They were very easy to set up; they gave me no trouble at all. Once I set them up they sounded wonderful. They are great for all the bassy songs I listen to (mostly EDM). They get pretty loud. There is a bass control knob on the back of the subwoofer so it can be easily adjusted. The volume control looks pretty cool and can extend to anywhere on your desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Mine Lasted 2 Whole Years!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two years ago almost to the day...I just noticed the subwoofer for these is no longer working. The sucky thing is I usually push my music to other speakers and really haven't used these a whole lot. While it lasts it's a nice set of speakers, but save up a little more and get something you won't have to buy again down the line.
customer_reviews.author: TSG

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: At the time of writing this review, I've had this product for several months now. I use these speakers with a Windows/PC machine. Easy to connect to my desktop computer. Personally, I love the easy to use dial control to adjust the volume. Sound is clear. I'm very satisfied with these speakers and would definitely recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: BookNerd

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LOGITECH SPEAKERS BUT NOT GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I love Logitech products because of their durability, sound and product quality and and this was the reason behind my purchase. These are not as good as expected but not bad at all...I use these on my new 40 inch TCL Roku TV and it brings out the sound much better. Overall a good purchase you will not regret it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It can get loud but it doesn't feel powerful, almost airy if that makes sense. My z150 Logitech speakers feel more powerful that these ones do... and they where so much cheaper and at a lower volume too... muddy highs and airy mids. The bass is the only thing good this these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: A great all purpose 2.1 system. Nice bass and not bad overall quality sound. The build quality seems fantastic as well. One reviewer mentioned you could get the same sound for half the price. This may be true but they won't look as nice or have the durability of a Logitech product. If you're an audiophile type who needs absolutely perfect sound than you should already know this price range won't get you that these days but for what it is and what it costs it's an easy 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: SpinachKiller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I love these speakers!!!! They bang but not overpowered and drowned out actual clean clear bass! I paired this with a set of dual surround speakers for $32 bucks and it's so amazing! Do reccomend if you want to spend a little more but want that premium feel without spending too much.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for your money, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Look there are not enough superlatives to describe the sturdiness of construction, ease of use and great sound quality. Especially for its size and price. You can easily use these speakers on any device or television. It have several attachments for that purpose, as well as a feature for hooking your headphones for personal use. LOVE this system.
customer_reviews.author: njmovieman

customer_reviews.title: Bad wiring
customer_reviews.text: My friend and I both owned this speaker set. Within a month one speaker went out for both of us. They’re useless now. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Impey

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Sound at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I just plugged this system into my headphone jack and suddenly my laptop had powerful, immersive sound. I wish I had found it long ago. It's not just great for music, but also for movies. The large sub-woofer really adds depth and richness to the sound. And the amount of bass from it is adjustable with a knob on the rear. I also love the large, yet unobtrusive volume knob. Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.author: Sling

customer_reviews.title: Not high end, but very good and a great value.
customer_reviews.text: I use for a computer that is hooked to the 60" TV in the living room. So they are used for general purpose sound, music, movies, everything. They are fairly loud (I will play Youtube music loops, then play guitar through my own amp along with it at moderate levels) and clear. Not a ton of bottom end, but adequate. Mids and highs are clear, not tinny or too bright, not muddy. Overall sound quality If this is the price range you want to be in, it is hard to beat the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmboy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but don't expect too much
customer_reviews.text: I struggled between 3 and 4 stars, but I'm thinking it is a solid 3. Good, crisp sound for a unit this price, but nothing overwhelmingly good. The price matches the product. Low price for average set. I'm going to buy the next step up for $100 and see what the extra $35 gets you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deep bass if...
customer_reviews.text: Puts out phenomenal base if you position the sub right in the room. If you put it in the center of the room you get nearly no bass. But if you place it in a corner and stand in the middle of the room it sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Decent Speakers for price
customer_reviews.text: My old Logitech speakers succumbed to lightning. I still liked the sound of them even though they were made of white plastic, including the sub. The new speakers sound pretty good, however, the subwoofer is not as good as I had hoped. For the price the sound is decent.
customer_reviews.author: TerryG

customer_reviews.title: BEST SPEAKERS FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few years now and still very pleased—I buy headphones, earbuds, and speakers every year and generally don't rate them very often BUT these are the absolute best... and I've purchased Bose, Sennheiser, Sony, etc. The quality blew me away for this price—even compared to Bose, these speakers are the clearest (not muddy at all) and the sound is balanced with the option to get powerful bass if that is what you desire. If you're an average person or even an audiophile, these might be the best speakers you can buy and DEFINITELY the best speakers you can buy for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great look, practical, simple.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with my purchase. There are several reviews mentioning a lack of hevey bass. I feel great about the amount of low end. They sound quite balenced and pleasent to me. I found the cord for the volume control to be a workable length. Love the look, love the sound, love the rca connections for the speakers and line level sources. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great system for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great system for the price. Heavy bass, clear sound, and easy setup. I definitely recommend this if you are short on cash, but still want a quality system.
customer_reviews.author: Willomore

customer_reviews.title: Subwoofer is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set in February of 2020. Its been used 30 or so times nothing crazy. When I first started using it I was pleased with the quality for the price. Now I have to have the bass on the sub turned all the way up just to kinda hear it. I've checked all the wires and connection. Tried multiple sounds sources with the same result. Pretty sad this product only made it a 6-7 months before needing replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Home/Dorm/Private Office System
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive 2.1 system, this is a great value. The sound is pretty good (although I use my studio monitors for "serious" music listening). Some have observed that bass can be muddy, but I believe that is more a function of overdriving the subwoofer to achieve "bass that you can feel", a foolish exercise with any small speaker system. The detached volume control might seem like gimcrack until you use it; it is more convenient that software volume controls. I've purchased a second set for use with my Echo Dot, and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Bellopheron

customer_reviews.title: Very good computer speakers / small room. Use 24bit studio.
customer_reviews.text: As a reminder windows defaults to a really bad bit rate and up it to 24bit to get the most out of this. 16bit sounded awful. Keep this in mind when reading sound quality reviews some people don't try and make it work, and they blame the product. Configure the device in the sound control panel. No, not paid for review.
customer_reviews.author: Eric, USA

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. People are freaking out about the tweeter being fake but they still sound good for $50. I do wish they were more module so that if you didn’t want to use the base you could just connect the two speakers to your monitor. Probably will be getting a different pair shortly but for $50 they aren’t terrible.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Logitech speakers for over 15 years. I currently have 3 different systems using them now. They have yet to fail me or give me any problems. The sound is great. I use them on desktop computer systems and will continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Glass

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are everything especially when you pay for something. That being said right out of the box these are great. I love them. They have amazing bass and great mid/highs. The thing is they are not studio quality if you want that you will spend $300+ not $60. I think that's why many people are disappointed by these (beside the fake tweeter). Bottom line for $60ish these are about the best thing you could get. If you want better sound quality you will spend a lot more so look elsewhere. If you are a broke college student looking for something nice to fill that hole deep inside you. These are for you.
customer_reviews.author: seanMJP

customer_reviews.title: Hidden ON / OFF Switch
customer_reviews.text: The ON / OFF switch is on the unique separate wired volume control. It came from the factory in the off position so until I tracked down the hidden ON / OFF switch, I thought something was broken. Otherwise, great clear loud sound from the 2 front speaks. Bass is ok but not very strong. A huge improvement for the 32" TV with a 1/8 jack. DW
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: "The tweeter is fake," And...?
customer_reviews.text: The top tweeter of the speakers is fake, and that kinda sucks. However, the sound is great, full stop. I wish there was an option to increase the bass further, however the speakers sound great and I don't see anything wrong with them at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Gaffaneys

customer_reviews.title: I am not impressed with these speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have had other Logitech branded speakers in the past, but this one does not sound good at all for the price point. It has the sounds quality of a much lower priced generic brand... Its too bad, because they look nice on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bittan

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: No treble adjustment No Logitech Software available Subwoofer dead on arrival in process of getting refund
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price ($52 at the time) its just fine. Replaced a set of Logitech 313's that developed a loud hum while plugged in. These are much louder of course, but by no means is the tonality any better than the 313's were. Side by side, there was no difference. These are just step up in volume. The Base is not as intense like others have pointed out, but not enough to deduct a star for. These are not for a hard core audiophile of course.
customer_reviews.author: Gumper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are great sounding speakers. I'm baffled by the addition of a fake tweeter on the speaker pairs. I assume that it's there for esthetic reasons but it gives the impression that they are trying to trick the user. However, this does not alter the fact that these are a nice set of speakers that are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for 10 year old surround sound speakers
customer_reviews.text: These were a replacement for 10 year old surround sound speakers that my husband had for his computer. The sound quality is great, the amount of sound these speakers can put out is pretty amazing. Great speakers, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MN-Wholockian

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Port Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this item and then a replacement. Both had the same issue. The port for the right side speaker was not functioning, sound was very scratchy like it wasn't making a full connection. The left side port had great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound was great, but they ended up 'popping' and ceased to ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound was great, but they ended up 'popping' and ceased to work after a week. I may have just been unlucky. This was during a normal volume level. Returned for another model. I really did love the volume control pod on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great, for  the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and good sound. I marked the volume control down a notch, because it is so light it takes two hands to turn sound on or off, as well as any adjustment to the volume. Works great, just takes two hands.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hagel

customer_reviews.title: My $20 computer speakers sounded better
customer_reviews.text: I wanted speakers that were an upgrade to my $20 logitech speakers to use with my TV. I made a bad choice. The sound of these speakers is all washed out and crackling when anything big happens. Talking sounds fine, but action sounds terrible. I've used them lost the box and now I'm stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers for a Great price
customer_reviews.text: I love these Speakers. I have a Podcast I do ( Not making big bucks yet!! Lol ) so I need some Quality sound without breaking the bank. All the other ones I used in the same price range were horrible nothing but issues. These have been great. Sound quality, Bass, being user friendly is why I love them. I know for more money I can buy better speakers but for the price I not one bad thing to say about theses. I do love the turn dial volume control that’s a big plus. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Cavey Jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice & Compact
customer_reviews.text: Only had it one day but appears to be working fine. Easy to set up and I like that it is fairly compact. I also like the the speakers look like speakers and not some space age rocket ship like so many do now. Hard to give it five stars after only one day but I will update if worth it.
customer_reviews.author: N2WATA

customer_reviews.title: No bass "okay" audio quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price point you would expect something better than this. The speakers sound "okay" but there is 0 bass at all. I was going to return it today and I realized I'm just a day too late. Used once and put right back in box. Super loss of $60 think half that is worth while.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Awesome speakers, the bass is not as deep and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome speakers, the bass is not as deep and punchy as you would want for a home studio or something like that, but if just watching shows and movies... or playing video games it works very very well, the little volume knob thing is great and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This speaker set up is actually pretty good for the price. The only downside of it. is the really short cord for the controller! The base is REALLY good...especially for the price. The sound is pretty crisp too. You can hook these speakers up to a tv, stereo, computer, cell phone, tablet...anything you want as long as it has the regular headphone jack! I LOVE that feature. I'd like to get a second set of speakers just for the tv in the living room. I use this for my personal computer in my room/office to stream live videos of my art. My viewers say that the sound is really good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Donating it to thrift shop....
customer_reviews.text: So... I've had this for like two months maybe? The aux cord stopped working last week, which sucks cause it's permanently attached to the subwoofer. There's an aux input on your volume control dial though, which is a last resort. Today, like 5 minutes ago, my subwoofer stopped working. I'm no party animal. I don't play bassy music at max volume. In fact I probably only put 3 hours total of play time into it at medium/low volume. It's just poor quality. I regret buying it. Donating it to GoodWill thrift shop.
customer_reviews.author: Bill bo' Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why the bad reviews. This audio system is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the bad reviews. This audio system is amazing, the base hits hard and the highs and mids are crisp. The volume dial is a great touch, and allows excellent control of perfect volume. I use this for gaming, music and movies and don't have one complaint at all.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: These get louder than needed and provide a good quality sound. I purchased these for my parents who like to play Pandora when they're how cooking/eating and when guests are over. It gets loud enough that it can be heard in another room for when they have large parties over and the quality of the sound isn't compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice 2.1
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need or want 5.1 or 7.1, like I didn't, this a very good purchase. The drivers are large enough to give you great sound quality, and the bass is deep. Logitech. What can I say.
customer_reviews.author: Lostviking

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are easy to setup and use. They have good sound quality. Prefect for a computer. I really like the volume control. It sits on my desk and one can quickly change the volume. No more fiddling with mouse to lower/increase the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Cmg

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, tinny, fake tweeter.
customer_reviews.text: The tweeters are fake. That should tell you everything you need to know, but in case you still want to know more, I do not recommend these speakers. They sound awful. I sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: James Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great sound speakers for the money! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: These are some excellent speakers. These are a great fit for a den or living room. They install really easily using standard audio cords that you can get on Amazon or Best Buy or Walmart. The speakers are loud and you can easily adjust the settings. I use these speakers in my den/movie room and they fill it with crisp & clear sound. Very pleased. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Q.

customer_reviews.title: OH MY GOD !!!
customer_reviews.text: i have bought many speakers for my computer and most were a flop .i don't hear so good any more so i seen these speakers and said to myself while not so i bought them AND THEY ARE AWSOME AWSOME so so happy the sound is great !! just my opion LOVE EM
customer_reviews.author: bryan lake

customer_reviews.title: Arcade speakers
customer_reviews.text: Using these as arcade speakers. Sound quality seems fine, but have only heard video games. Just be aware that the tweeter is fake. Satellite speakers are just individual speakers.
customer_reviews.author: CWN

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, unavailable support
customer_reviews.text: Within a few days of receiving this the thin wire going from the subwoofer to the input tore, rendering the entire system unusable. Not possible to replace this since, of course, it's embedded. I've spent months trying to get a RMA from Logitech - usually their service is pretty solid - but I suppose due to COVID their entire support system is broken and useless. Can't recommend a poor design like that, regardless, but especially not when Logitech is unable to assist.
customer_reviews.author: Maxxify

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers.  Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my home music studio as I don't have a lot of room for actual pro series monitors and thow these are only 80 watts they sound GREAT and fill up a 1200 square foot apartment with clear sound at high volumes! no complaints here...PLUS - I got them as an open box item!
customer_reviews.author: Otniel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers. Have them hooked up to my computer and my TV. Loud and bass is pumping. Not to over the top with the bass though. Can really play loads of different content with them. Haven't done a movie yet but I imagine that it will be amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R.

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: What can I say they are Logitech and 80 Watts. The sub adds a whole dimension to the sound has a nice clean sound no need to crank it. Delivers clean highs and solid bass. What are you waiting for Get you some!!
customer_reviews.author: Dudeman

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I love the speakers I upgraded from the older version of logic and these are just as awesome by the way don’t buy these if you live in an apartment to avoid noise complaints. Great bass
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers, very very loud when turned up all ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Speakers, very very loud when turned up all the way! Very crisp sound and clean no pops or distortions, it does distort when full volume. I am not a audiophile, I just purchased these to upgrade from the speakers built into my monitor. The cords are quite long but not idea for huge desks. The bass is not for heavy bass lovers but it gets the job done! Would recommend these speakers for anyone who is upgrading from something else but if you are a true audiophile you would want to look for something more of value. These are great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a couple of months now and really enjoy the sound. The on/off/volume really makes it easy to use. Would be nice if it had an equalizer but for the money, it's fine. Hardly any distortion and plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo

customer_reviews.title: Sounds pretty good for its size and price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect. Not audiophile quality, but sounds pretty good for its size and price. I have it connected to a computer where I use MAME to run old arcade games from the late '70s and early '80s, plus listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Since 1998

customer_reviews.title: Expected way less, when looking at the 60$ price tag.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to have a 2.1 with decent quality (not those paper boxes for 20$), an external vol control (not on the speaker). Even that i had one of the best 2.1 for a few years (modded Z-2300), this does fine. Using the middle setting on the sub and adding a 30Hz boost (soundcard settings/EQ), makes it sound way better than cranking ub the sub level to max.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Fine for my needs
customer_reviews.text: They sound very good for music, movies, and games - and I'm a fairly harsh critic of speakers. Everything feels solid. I would prefer that the remote clicked 'off' at the furthest-Left position, but there is an on/off switch instead. These are replacing an old worn-out Creative system that was more powerful/more expensive, and these are 95% as good as that system used to be when it was new or almost new. I got an excellent deal on Amazon... $39 or close to that. Even at $50, it would still be a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an Xbox speaker companion. They work very well for this purpose. I have bought many different Logitech computer speakers over the years, and they are consistently excellent values and good performers. It's good to see that Logitech is still leading the pack after all these years.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D Heires

product_meta.title: Logitech Z333 2.1 Speakers – Easy-access Volume Control, Headphone Jack – PC, Mobile Device, TV, DVD/Blueray Player, and Game Console Compatible
product_meta.description: Logitech Multimedia Speakers z333 deliver 80 watts peak power with a deep bass response adding intensity to your music, movies and games System requirements: Television|Computer|Smartphone|Tablet|Music player|DVD player|Blu-ray player|PlayStation|Xbox|Wii
feature_bullets: STRONG BASS - The front-facing subwoofer produces rich bass, adding another dimension to your videos, games and music. Experience strong bass you can hear and feel.
VERSATILE SETUP – Connect up to two compatible devices via the 3.5 millimeter and RCA inputs. No need to disconnect when switching between audio sources.
SIMPLE CONTROLS - Easily access power, volume and the headphone jack using the wired control pod. Adjust the bass level with the dedicated control knob on the back of the subwoofer.
NOTE: Refer user manual before use
Front-facing subwoofer: 5 inch driver adds deep, intense bass to your music, movies and games.
Convenient wired control pod: Easily access volume and power, plus a headphone jack for private listening.
Adjustable bass control: Quickly boost the bass with a turn of the on-subwoofer control knob.

Works with computer running on any major operating system (Windows, Mac, Chromebooks), smartphones, tablets, televisions, MP3 players, DVD / Blue-ray players, and game consoles such as PlayStation 3, Xbox 360

80 WATTS OF BOLD SOUND -80 Watts Peak/40 Watts RMS power delivers maximum loudness via two satellite speakers and a large subwoofer. Enjoy rich, clear, bold sound. (Small driver (tweeter) on satellite speakers is decorative and non-operational)
Headphone jack - Listen to your music privately via the headphone jack located on the front of the right speaker.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,944 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
